title: More page and Account page
custom_preconds:
* User has latest build installed 
* User is not signed in
custom_steps:
Given the user has voiceover turned on
When the user navigates to the More Page
And the Account Page
custom_expected:
Then the Login and Create MLB Account have been made into buttons
And the "2022 Chevy MLB All Star Ballot" button is made into a link
And Film room, Podcast, Starting lineups are called out
And Make the apps into BUTTONs

title: Standings Page
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on More > Standings
custom_expected:
THEN leagues should be headings
AND leagues should be ordered after the next sub heading
AND "Standings current as of" should be read
AND Wild Card legend should be read first when user navigated to wild card tab

title: MLB.TV Login Screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
AND the user is a free user
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the TV paywall
custom_expected:
THEN Subscription Features is an action
AND price buttons are reachable
AND "Cancel anytime" is read with the text
AND "Already purchased?" is read with "Restore"
AND the Close button is reachable

title: Home Screen Icon Accessibility
custom_preconds:
* User has latest build 
* User is logged in 
* User has voiceover turned on
custom_steps:
Given the user is on the Home Screen Icon Page
When voiceover is on
custom_expected:
Then the icon image (current image) will not be read
And other images for other icons won't be read
And Section headings are headers
And "Personalize" and "you've selected" are combined

title: First Launch Screen
custom_preconds:
* User has latest build
* User has voiceover turned on
* Fresh install of app
custom_steps:
Given the user opens the app for the first time
When the app opens
custom_expected:
Then voiceover focus will start on text and not the image
And no accessibility element for "login MLB Logo" (this will be revamped in the fututre
And "Continue with MLB with email label" are combined
And the above combo will be a button

title: Settings
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on settings in more menu
custom_expected: THEN setting is read

title: Team Name
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps:
WHEN the user taps on the team menu in settings
AND then taps on a team
custom_expected: THEN the team name is read

title: Team Game Schedule
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps:
WHEN the user taps on a team 
AND then taps on the game schedule up top
custom_expected: THEN the day and month are read

title: Teams Calendar
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on More > Teams > Schedule > Calendar
custom_expected: THEN each element will be read

title: Team Rosters
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on More > Team > Roster
custom_expected: THEN the player name and number, as well as position will be read

title: Team Standings
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on More > Team > Standings
custom_expected: THEN each element will be read

title: Webview
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on the elements on webview (From more menu)
custom_expected: THEN the user will have the elements on the top/bottom of the webview read correctly.

title: Swiping through games
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user swipes through games on the scoreboard
custom_expected: THEN the game details will be read

title: Gameday Highlight
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps:
WHEN the user taps on Gameday 
AND taps on a highlight
custom_expected: THEEN the highlight header is read

title: MLB.tv Feed
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on MLB.tv feed
custom_expected: THEN the game and feed are read

title: Launcher Icon
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user launches the app
custom_expected: THEN the At Bat launcher icon is read

title: Main Nav Buttons
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on one of the main nav buttons at the bottom of the app
custom_expected: THEN the nav button is properly read

title: Favorite Team Icon
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps:
WHEN the user launches the app for the first time
AND the favorite team options are displayed
AND the user taps on a team name
custom_expected: THEN the team name button is properly read

title: News Article Header
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on the news article header from the news section
custom_expected: THEN the news article header is read

title: News Article Full
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on the news article
custom_expected: THEN the full news article will be read

title: Embedded Video
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps:
WHEN the user taps on the news tab
AND opens up a news article with an embedded video and double taps on the video
custom_expected: THEN the video will play

title: Audio Feeds
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on audio feeds once feeds are available
custom_expected: THEN the audio stream name is read

title: Audio Icon
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has enabled voiceover in the iOS accessibility settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on the audio icon
custom_expected: THEN the audio icon is read
